message.body: hey
hey
I found your passport
really? huh
I thought I had that
hopefully you don't have any trips planned
nah
I have your haight ashbury tshirt and some more of your mail
ok, I just sent you some stuff in the mail yesterday
ah, a package
yep, license plate, phone charger cd, some random things that were in the car
so you movin this weekend?
Aug. 7
oh, I just assumed youd move in the 1st
barry moves in this w/e. He painted your old room. White walls, with a red accent wall and black trm
how's it look?
strange, but it's alright. Im having carpet installed tomorrow

you know Andres, you told me that you were treating me with indifference because you were bored and looking for something more extraordinary. That still sits pretty heavy on me. I'm trying to move forward so that I can meet someone who will treat me nicely
I thought I treated you nicely for the most part
something changed, and im not really sure why
I felt like things just got to predictable. I needed something exciting in my life, not ness. in a relationship way, just something

Well, certainly turning around and walking away from me the last time we ever saw eachther, no goodbye, no well wishes, I felt pretty much the same way that made me fed up, unimportant, uncared for. And I kida felt sorry for you.
after a while, a relationship looses some of it's fire. It's inevitable and it happens regarless
I'm sorry about that. It just felt easier
I got the feeling that there was more you wanted to say, but I wasn't sure I wanted to hear it
well it was just that I wanted to say goodbye and wish you well.
You can't imagine how crazy the last few weeks have been
right, and I wasn't sure I wanted to hear that
It's like the ben harper song, " stones from my enemies, these wounds will mend, but I cannot survive roses from my friends."
well I hope you can work that out.
I am happy right now. Life is good. But I still can't help but think that I am missing out on something that was good for me. Something secure. I haven't had a lot of security in my life

and I don't want to let go of that. I believed that if we were apart for a while, we would either move on or we would find ourselves together again, perhaps with a newfound appreciation for each other.
but as time goes on, I feel that the opportunity has passed and I have to face a new life and it's lonely. I enjoy the freedom, but I dont like the feeling of being alone
Nobody does. I felt pretty lonely in our relationship. I feel much better about myself now.
why did you feel lonely with me?

because I needed more attention and affection I can think of some examples:I would get in the car after not seeing you for a while and you wouldn't say hello or kiss me or anything, I would walk in the house or you would walk in the house and rarely look at me or say hello, I would initiate affection and you would not receive it, like example I can think of that you squirmed your way out of a hug, I would share my feelings with you and you would call me dramatic and tell me that you were fine so I should be fine, I would do nice things for you and you thought I was upto something, you spent more time on your computer rather then on me, you only wanted to do things that interested you, and you didn't believe in thank yous
I think what you are missing here is that those things had less to do with you and more to do with me
well they affected me obviously
I was an unhappy person at that point in my life and I felt like all I could see was the bad in thing
of course
It's funny because I actually understand how you feel better now
yes, well I'm quite a catch in my opinion. I know I'm not perfect. But I think I am a pretty interesting girl with alot to offer to a relationship
*I now have a better understanding of how you felt
I have always agreed
the problem was internally with me
I am just never satisfied
It was hard for me to see that and not take it personally. But once you started getting more angry something inside of me just said hold on a minute here, I know I don't deserve this.
perhaps there is something out there that will fill that void. I feel my life is getting better, and has been getting better all along
Well that's good.
but a few years back I was really lost and I didnt know if I would be able to overcome it
Well, I'm pretty sure you were alot more inlove with that Kari chick, because she needed you more.
then I met you and I was glad, but still struggled to get past some of those things
I felt guilty for not caring more about you, but I realized that it was probably just my way of staying safe
the way I felt about her was different. It was not a healthy relationship, but it was very gratifying in many ways
well, what should I do about the passport and stuff? Can you send it to me? BTW the mail should be stopping soon.
yeah, I guess I could ship it to you sometime.
did any of the mail look time sensitive?
not that I recall

ok, hey I wanted to thank you for the help with finding me a car again. I'm not sure if you know how much I appreciate it. I got it inspected this week, and it just needed 2 new tires. Dude said it was in pretty good shape. He was impressed.
funny, there is something about helping that makes me feel worthwhile. Perhaps I just wasn't feeling helpful enough. Not working, accepting help from you with the bills, etc.
It's something I have been noticing lately. I notice a lot of things lately
Perhaps we could get together sometime if you are feeling up to it. Maybe some thai. Let me know

You should probably know even though it might not be easy to hear, but I've met somebody. It's nothing major but he's a pretty nice and interesting guy. And remember how we both agreed that I need to date really nice guy.
Im guessing that means you think us hanging out is a bad idea
FYI: guys are always nice in the beginning. Remember how I was in the beginning. I don't have a problem with you seeing anyone. I don't expect you to just sit by and be alone
yep i know, but this guy is my friends brother, and I kinda trust that the nice part is for real. But anyway, nope I don't think hanging out is a great idea right now.
since we are being honest, I am also seeing someone, and she is not really nice. I almost feel like I am dating myself, and it is very enlightening
hahahaha, sorry that kinda made me laugh out loud. Well, maybe at least you'll understand eachother a little better

it's very exciting, but not very stable. I sometimes wish for something more comfortable, even though I know it would compromize the excitement, go figure....I guess you just always want what you don't have
well, perhaps you should just enjoy the excitement for now. I got's to go get some lunch.
thats the plan, but it's just not what I am used to so it will take time. Enjoy your nice guy. Have fun!
you too.
